notes: Definite integrals are core to both the calculation of area and the connection between differentiation and integration.
The value of a definite integral is a number (not a function, as in indefinite integrals).
The precise use of limits and continuity is crucial for the correct evaluation of definite integrals.
tips_to_approach: Always check if the function to be integrated is defined and continuous over the given interval.
Remember: For definite integrals, the constant of integration cancels out – do not include it.
Practice breaking down complex integrands into simpler forms or use substitution/partial fractions if necessary.
Know when to use geometric interpretation (area) and when to use anti-derivatives (calculation).
